articles.title: Joint Statement from OpenAI and Microsoft
articles.summary: Microsoft and OpenAI continue to work closely across research, engineering, and product development, building on years of deep collaboration and shared success.

articles.title: Introducing the Stateful Runtime Environment for Agents in Amazon Bedrock
articles.summary: Stateful Runtime for Agents in Amazon Bedrock brings persistent orchestration, memory, and secure execution to multi-step AI workflows powered by OpenAI.

articles.title: Scaling AI for everyone
articles.summary: Today we’re announcing $110B in new investment at a $730B pre money valuation. This includes $30B from SoftBank, $30B from NVIDIA, and $50B from Amazon.

articles.title: OpenAI and Amazon announce strategic partnership
articles.summary: OpenAI and Amazon announce a strategic partnership bringing OpenAI’s Frontier platform to AWS, expanding AI infrastructure, custom models, and enterprise AI agents.

articles.title: An update on our mental health-related work
articles.summary: OpenAI shares updates on its mental health safety work, including parental controls, trusted contacts, improved distress detection, and recent litigation developments.

articles.title: Pacific Northwest National Laboratory and OpenAI partner to accelerate federal permitting
articles.summary: OpenAI and Pacific Northwest National Laboratory introduce DraftNEPABench, a new benchmark evaluating how AI coding agents can accelerate federal permitting—showing potential to reduce NEPA drafting time by up to 15% and modernize infrastructure reviews.

articles.title: OpenAI Codex and Figma launch seamless code-to-design experience
articles.summary: OpenAI and Figma launch a new Codex integration that connects code and design, enabling teams to move between implementation and the Figma canvas to iterate and ship faster.

articles.title: Disrupting malicious uses of AI | February 2026
articles.summary: Our latest threat report examines how malicious actors combine AI models with websites and social platforms—and what it means for detection and defense.

articles.title: Arvind KC appointed Chief People Officer
articles.summary: OpenAI appoints Arvind KC as Chief People Officer to help scale the company, strengthen its culture, and lead how work evolves in the age of AI.

articles.title: Why we no longer evaluate SWE-bench Verified
articles.summary: SWE-bench Verified is increasingly contaminated and mismeasures frontier coding progress. Our analysis shows flawed tests and training leakage. We recommend SWE-bench Pro.

articles.title: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners
articles.summary: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.

articles.title: Our First Proof submissions
articles.summary: We share our AI model’s proof attempts for the First Proof math challenge, testing research-grade reasoning on expert-level problems.

articles.title: Advancing independent research on AI alignment
articles.summary: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.

articles.title: Introducing OpenAI for India
articles.summary: OpenAI for India expands AI access across the country—building local infrastructure, powering enterprises, and advancing workforce skills.

articles.title: Introducing EVMbench
articles.summary: OpenAI and Paradigm introduce EVMbench, a benchmark evaluating AI agents’ ability to detect, patch, and exploit high-severity smart contract vulnerabilities.

articles.title: GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
articles.summary: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.

articles.title: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT
articles.summary: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT to help organizations defend against prompt injection and AI-driven data exfiltration.

articles.title: Beyond rate limits: scaling access to Codex and Sora
articles.summary: How OpenAI built a real-time access system combining rate limits, usage tracking, and credits to power continuous access to Sora and Codex.

articles.title: Scaling social science research
articles.summary: GABRIEL is a new open-source toolkit from OpenAI that uses GPT to turn qualitative text and images into quantitative data, helping social scientists analyze research at scale.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark
articles.summary: Introducing GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark—our first real-time coding model. 15x faster generation, 128k context, now in research preview for ChatGPT Pro users.

articles.title: Harness engineering: leveraging Codex in an agent-first world
articles.summary: By Ryan Lopopolo, Member of the Technical Staff

articles.title: Bringing ChatGPT to GenAI.mil
articles.summary: OpenAI for Government announces the deployment of a custom ChatGPT on GenAI.mil, bringing secure, safety-forward AI to U.S. defense teams.

articles.title: Testing ads in ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI begins testing ads in ChatGPT to support free access, with clear labeling, answer independence, strong privacy protections, and user control.

articles.title: Making AI work for everyone, everywhere: our approach to localization
articles.summary: OpenAI shares its approach to AI localization, showing how globally shared frontier models can be adapted to local languages, laws, and cultures without compromising safety.

articles.title: GPT-5 lowers the cost of cell-free protein synthesis
articles.summary: An autonomous lab combining OpenAI’s GPT-5 with Ginkgo Bioworks’ cloud automation cut cell-free protein synthesis costs by 40% through closed-loop experimentation.

articles.title: Introducing Trusted Access for Cyber
articles.summary: OpenAI introduces Trusted Access for Cyber, a trust-based framework that expands access to frontier cyber capabilities while strengthening safeguards against misuse.

articles.title: Introducing OpenAI Frontier
articles.summary: OpenAI Frontier is an enterprise platform for building, deploying, and managing AI agents with shared context, onboarding, permissions, and governance.

articles.title: GPT-5.3-Codex System Card
articles.summary: GPT‑5.3-Codex is the most capable agentic coding model to date, combining the frontier coding performance of GPT‑5.2-Codex with the reasoning and professional knowledge capabilities of GPT‑5.2.

articles.title: Navigating health questions with ChatGPT
articles.summary: A family shares how ChatGPT helped them prepare for critical cancer treatment decisions for their son alongside expert guidance from his doctors.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.3-Codex
articles.summary: GPT-5.3-Codex is a Codex-native agent that pairs frontier coding performance with general reasoning to support long-horizon, real-world technical work.

articles.title: Unlocking the Codex harness: how we built the App Server
articles.summary: Learn how to embed the Codex agent using the Codex App Server, a bidirectional JSON-RPC API powering streaming progress, tool use, approvals, and diffs.

articles.title: VfL Wolfsburg turns ChatGPT into a club-wide capability
articles.summary: By focusing on people, not pilots, the Bundesliga club is scaling efficiency, creativity, and knowledge—without losing its football identity.

articles.title: The Sora feed philosophy
articles.summary: Discover the Sora feed philosophy—built to spark creativity, foster connections, and keep experiences safe with personalized recommendations, parental controls, and strong guardrails.

articles.title: Snowflake and OpenAI partner to bring frontier intelligence to enterprise data
articles.summary: OpenAI and Snowflake partner in a $200M agreement to bring frontier intelligence into enterprise data, enabling AI agents and insights directly in Snowflake.

articles.title: Introducing the Codex app
articles.summary: Introducing the Codex app for macOS—a command center for AI coding and software development with multiple agents, parallel workflows, and long-running tasks.

articles.title: Inside OpenAI’s in-house data agent
articles.summary: How OpenAI built an in-house AI data agent that uses GPT-5, Codex, and memory to reason over massive datasets and deliver reliable insights in minutes.

articles.title: Retiring GPT-4o, GPT-4.1, GPT-4.1 mini, and OpenAI o4-mini in ChatGPT
articles.summary: On February 13, 2026, alongside the previously announced retirement⁠ of GPT‑5 (Instant, Thinking, and Pro), we will retire GPT‑4o, GPT‑4.1, GPT‑4.1 mini, and OpenAI o4-mini from ChatGPT. In the API, there are no changes at this time.

articles.title: Taisei Corporation shapes the next generation of talent with ChatGPT
articles.summary: Taisei Corporation uses ChatGPT Enterprise to support HR-led talent development and scale generative AI across its global construction business.

articles.title: The next chapter for AI in the EU
articles.summary: OpenAI launches the EU Economic Blueprint 2.0 with new data, partnerships, and initiatives to accelerate AI adoption, skills, and growth across Europe.

articles.title: EMEA Youth & Wellbeing Grant
articles.summary: Apply for the EMEA Youth & Wellbeing Grant, a €500,000 program funding NGOs and researchers advancing youth safety and wellbeing in the age of AI.

articles.title: Keeping your data safe when an AI agent clicks a link
articles.summary: Learn how OpenAI protects user data when AI agents open links, preventing URL-based data exfiltration and prompt injection with built-in safeguards.

articles.title: PVH reimagines the future of fashion with OpenAI
articles.summary: PVH Corp., parent company of Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, is adopting ChatGPT Enterprise to bring AI into fashion design, supply chain, and consumer engagement.

articles.title: Powering tax donations with AI powered personalized recommendations
articles.summary: TRUSTBANK partnered with Recursive to build Choice AI using OpenAI models, delivering personalized, conversational recommendations that simplify Furusato Nozei gift discovery. A multi-agent system helps donors navigate thousands of options and find gifts that match their preferences.

articles.title: Introducing Prism
articles.summary: Prism is a free LaTeX-native workspace with GPT-5.2 built in, helping researchers write, collaborate, and reason in one place.

articles.title: How Indeed uses AI to help evolve the job search
articles.summary: Indeed’s CRO Maggie Hulce shares how AI is transforming job search, recruiting, and talent acquisition for employers and job seekers.

articles.title: Unrolling the Codex agent loop
articles.summary: A technical deep dive into the Codex agent loop, explaining how Codex CLI orchestrates models, tools, prompts, and performance using the Responses API.

articles.title: Scaling PostgreSQL to power 800 million ChatGPT users
articles.summary: An inside look at how OpenAI scaled PostgreSQL to millions of queries per second using replicas, caching, rate limiting, and workload isolation.

articles.title: Inside Praktika's conversational approach to language learning
articles.summary: How Praktika uses GPT-4.1 and GPT-5.2 to build adaptive AI tutors that personalize lessons, track progress, and help learners achieve real-world language fluency

articles.title: Inside GPT-5 for Work: How Businesses Use GPT-5
articles.summary: A data-driven report on how workers across industries use ChatGPT—covering adoption trends, top tasks, departmental patterns, and the future of AI at work.

articles.title: How Higgsfield turns simple ideas into cinematic social videos
articles.summary: Discover how Higgsfield gives creators cinematic, social-first video output from simple inputs using OpenAI GPT-4.1, GPT-5, and Sora 2.
